trans-unit.source: PowerShellGallery.com does not support permanent deletion of items, because that would break anyone who is depending on it remaining available.
trans-unit.target: PowerShellGallery.com does not support permanent deletion of items, because that would break anyone who is depending on it remaining available.

trans-unit.source: Instead, PowerShellGallery.com supports a way to 'unlist' an item, which can be done in the item management page on the web site.
trans-unit.target: Instead, PowerShellGallery.com supports a way to 'unlist' an item, which can be done in the item management page on the web site.

trans-unit.source: When an item is unlisted, it no longer shows up in search and in any item listing, both on PowerShellGallery.com and using PowerShellGet commands.
trans-unit.target: When an item is unlisted, it no longer shows up in search and in any item listing, both on PowerShellGallery.com and using PowerShellGet commands.

trans-unit.source: However, it remains downloadable by specifying its exact version, which is what allows the automated scripts to continue working.
trans-unit.target: However, it remains downloadable by specifying its exact version, which is what allows the automated scripts to continue working.

trans-unit.source: If you run into an exceptional situation where you think one of your items must be deleted, this can be handled manually by the PowerShell Gallery team.
trans-unit.target: If you run into an exceptional situation where you think one of your items must be deleted, this can be handled manually by the PowerShell Gallery team.

trans-unit.source: e.g. if there is a copyright infringement issue, or potentially harmful content, that could be a valid reason to delete it.
trans-unit.target: e.g. if there is a copyright infringement issue, or potentially harmful content, that could be a valid reason to delete it.

trans-unit.source: You should submit a support request through [PowerShell Gallery] (http://www.PowerShellGallery.com) in that case.
trans-unit.target: You should submit a support request through [PowerShell Gallery] (http://www.PowerShellGallery.com) in that case.
